meanings.definition: Light and thin in a way that is attractive or delicate.
meanings.sent1: The gauzier fabric fluttered gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: She wore a gauzier dress to the elegant party.
meanings.sent3: The gauzier curtains danced like fairies in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as gauzier than a cloud in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The delicate petals of the flower were gauzier than silk.

meanings.definition: Made of a thin, loosely woven fabric.
meanings.sent1: The gauzier scarf kept her warm on chilly evenings.
meanings.sent2: He bought a gauzier shirt for the hot summer days.
meanings.sent3: The gauzier hammock swayed gently under the weight of the cat.
meanings.sent4: The gauzier net caught the colorful fish in the pond.
meanings.sent5: The gauzier veil added a touch of elegance to her outfit.
